Next, I'll look at the table provided. The table lists various representatives with their party affiliations, years they started, and how they were re-elected. Each row represents a different seat or district in Texas.

Now, the second part of the claim is about having no 1 vie. The term "vie" here likely means a candidate running against him. If he was unopposed, that implies there were zero other candidates contesting his seat. 

Looking at the table again, under the election results for Texas 20, it only mentions Henry B. Gonzalez as the candidate. There's no mention of any other candidate from another party or an independent running against him. This confirms that he had no opposition.

Therefore, both parts of the claim are supported by the data in the table. The relevant cells to verify this are the "Re-elected" and "Election result" columns for Henry B. Gonzalez's row.
